lines.gurmukhi: nhIN ddswr ipq ipqwmw pripqwmw sujn kutMb suq bwDv n BRwqw hY
lines.transliteration_english: Naheen Dadasaar Pit Pitaamaa Parapitaamaa , Sujan Koutanb Sout Baadhav N Bhraataa Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: In the paternal hierarchy, there is not one relation; whether grandfather, great grandfather or any other son of the family, ward or brother;

lines.gurmukhi: nhI nnswr mwqw prmwqw ibriD prmwqw mwmU mwmI mwsI AO mOsw ibibD ibKwqw hY
lines.transliteration_english: Nahee Nanasaar Maataa Paramaataa Biradhi Paramaataa , Maamoo Maamee Maasee Au Maousaa Bibidh Bikhaataa Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly there isn't any relation, whether it is mother, grandmother or great grandmother, maternal uncle, aunt or any other recognised relationships;

lines.gurmukhi: nhI ssurwr swsu susrw swro AauswrI nhI ibrqIsur mY jwick n dwqw hY
lines.transliteration_english: Nahee Sasuraar Saasu Sousaraa Saaro Aousaaree , Nahee Birateesur Mai Jaachik N Daataa Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: And also there is no relationship in the in-laws family whether mother-in-law, brother-in-law or sister-in-law; nor is their any relationship of family priest, donor or beggar.

lines.gurmukhi: Asn bsn Dn Dwm kwhU mY n dyiKE jYsw gurisK swDsMgq ko nwqw hY ]100]
lines.transliteration_english: Asan Basan Dhan Dhaam Kaahoo Mai N Daykhiao , Jaisaa Gursikh Saadhasangat Ko Naataa Hai ?100?

Shabad OS B.translation: Nor has any relationship been seen amongst the friends and close associates who share their eats and drinks as is the relationship of Sikh Sangat (congregation) and a Sikh. (100)
